questions.name: Whats true about action sets?
questions.hint: CREATING DYNAMIC CONTENT IN USER VIEWS

options.answer: action sets to configure dynamic UI changes based on the event-action model.
It has configuration to configure event which is nothing but a trigger performed by users, such as clicking a button, hovering a pointer over a field, or entering a value in a field.
It has configuration to configure an action which is a response performed by the system as a result of the user event. For example, when users click a button, the application creates a case.

It has configuration to configure an action which is Restrictions such as when rules, which can be applied to an event and action combination. For example, you can configure conditions so that hovering over a field displays a smart tip message only if the field contains a property value.
